review: I have an Apple TV but was hoping the Chromecase would allow me to mirror my Chrome browser to the TV.  Although this is advertised as a Beta feature, it is completely unusable.  The audio on the TV is fine but the video is out of sync and freezes frequently.  I have tried this with multiple computers on multiple wi-fi networks and it still causes problems.Although it will not be used at home, I plan on keeping this device.  It will be useful for Netflix while traveling and is more portable than the Apple TV.

author: Amazon Customer

review: Pretty much anything you can put in a Chrome browser you can show on you TV. You can upload Powerpoint slides and documents to Google Drive and present material wirelessly which is nice for business applications. I've tested it and it works well on PC, Mac, iPads, iPhones, and Android devices.A few improvements needed:1. My laptops get rather hot when broadcasting (tried on both a macbook and toshiba running windows 7, same results), yet my phone and ipad do not seem to be affected at all when broadcasting from them.2. Broadcasting from tablets and mobile devices is limited to Play Store, Netflix, and Youtube. Add some browser support for these as well. Add support for Amazon Prime Video, Pandora, and iHeart Radio at least.3. Sometimes the sound gets unsynced slightly and I have to stop and restart the broadcast to get it synced again.Over all it's a good product. A few improvements could make it a great product. Definitely worth $35.
